foundational.title: An Elegant Puzzle: Systems of Engineering Management
foundational.description: Will Larson's comprehensive guide to thinking about engineering organizations as systems, covering org design, sizing teams, and managing technical migrations at scale.

foundational.title: Good Strategy Bad Strategy
foundational.description: Richard Rumelt's foundational work on what makes strategy effective, teaching how to diagnose challenges, create guiding policies, and design coherent actions.

foundational.title: Thinking in Systems: A Primer
foundational.description: Donella Meadows' introduction to systems thinking, essential for understanding how organizational structures create emergent behaviors and feedback loops.

foundational.title: How to Think About Org-Level Strategy as an EM
foundational.description: A practical article on translating company-level objectives into engineering org strategies, including aligning team missions with business outcomes.

practical.title: Org Strategy Document Template
practical.description: A structured template for writing an engineering org strategy document that connects business context, technical landscape, key challenges, and a coherent plan of action.

practical.title: Wardley Mapping for Engineering Leaders
practical.description: Practice mapping your technology landscape using Wardley Maps to identify evolution stages, build vs. buy decisions, and strategic positioning of engineering investments.

practical.title: Strategy Review Simulation
practical.description: A facilitated exercise where participants present and critique org-level strategies, practicing the skill of identifying weak strategies and strengthening them with concrete diagnosis and action.

practical.title: Quarterly Strategy Alignment Exercise
practical.description: Map your team's current work to org-level strategic pillars, identify misalignments, and draft proposals for realigning efforts to maximize strategic impact.

advanced.title: Multi-Year Technical Strategy Case Studies
advanced.description: Analysis of real-world multi-year engineering strategies from companies like Spotify, Stripe, and Google, examining how they evolved org structure to support strategic shifts.

advanced.title: Strategic Leadership Peer Group
advanced.description: Join or form a peer group of senior engineering leaders who meet regularly to review and challenge each other's org-level strategies and share lessons learned.

advanced.title: Executive Strategy Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a VP or CTO-level mentor to develop the skill of reading business landscapes, identifying inflection points, and crafting strategies that position the engineering org for long-term success.

advanced.title: The Strategy Stack Framework
advanced.description: A layered framework for connecting company mission, business strategy, product strategy, and engineering strategy into a coherent stack where each layer reinforces the others.

foundational.title: Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less
foundational.description: Greg McKeown's guide to focusing on what truly matters, directly applicable to the challenge of saying no to good ideas in favor of great ones.

foundational.title: The Art of Prioritization for Engineering Leaders
foundational.description: A deep dive into prioritization frameworks including RICE, ICE, and weighted scoring models, with guidance on when each is most appropriate for engineering contexts.

foundational.title: Inspired: How to Create Tech Products People Love
foundational.description: Marty Cagan's work on product discovery and delivery, essential for understanding how to prioritize work that delivers genuine customer and business value.

foundational.title: Opportunity Cost Thinking for Engineers
foundational.description: A talk on applying economic thinking to engineering prioritization, understanding that every choice to build one thing is a choice not to build something else.

practical.title: RICE Scoring Workshop
practical.description: A hands-on session where teams score a backlog of real initiatives using Reach, Impact, Confidence, and Effort, then debate and calibrate their assessments.

practical.title: Priority Stack Ranking Template
practical.description: A spreadsheet template for stack-ranking engineering initiatives against strategic objectives, including fields for estimated impact, effort, risk, and strategic alignment.

practical.title: Saying No Exercise
practical.description: Practice the skill of declining requests constructively by role-playing scenarios where stakeholders push for work that doesn't align with current priorities, and crafting clear, empathetic responses.

practical.title: Cost of Delay Analysis
practical.description: Learn to quantify the cost of delay for different types of work (standard, urgent, fixed-date, intangible) and use this analysis to make sharper prioritization decisions.

advanced.title: Prioritization Under Uncertainty
advanced.description: A framework for making prioritization decisions when data is incomplete, combining lightweight experimentation, option-value thinking, and reversibility assessment.

advanced.title: Netflix and Spotify Prioritization Case Studies
advanced.description: Detailed examination of how high-performing engineering orgs balance platform investment, feature development, and technical debt reduction across multiple teams.

advanced.title: Senior EM Prioritization Peer Review
advanced.description: A structured peer review process where engineering leaders present their quarterly prioritization rationale and receive feedback on blind spots, missing considerations, and alternative framings.

advanced.title: Portfolio Management Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior leader experienced in managing a portfolio of engineering investments, learning to balance short-term delivery with long-term capability building.

foundational.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
foundational.description: Martin Kleppmann's essential guide to the principles and practicalities of data systems, covering consistency, partitioning, replication, and stream processing.

foundational.title: A Philosophy of Software Design
foundational.description: John Ousterhout's concise guide to managing complexity in software, focusing on deep modules, information hiding, and strategic vs. tactical programming.

foundational.title: System Design Interview (Vol 1 & 2)
foundational.description: Alex Xu's comprehensive walkthrough of large-scale system design problems, useful both for interviews and for building mental models of distributed systems.

foundational.title: Fundamentals of Software Architecture
foundational.description: A structured course covering architecture styles (monolith, microservices, event-driven), architecture characteristics (scalability, reliability), and the role of the architect in modern orgs.

practical.title: Architecture Decision Record (ADR) Template
practical.description: A lightweight template for documenting architecture decisions including context, decision, status, and consequences, fostering transparency and institutional memory.

practical.title: System Design Review Workshop
practical.description: A facilitated workshop where participants present system designs and receive structured feedback on scalability, reliability, operability, and alignment with business requirements.

practical.title: Failure Mode Analysis Exercise
practical.description: Take an existing system design and systematically identify failure modes, single points of failure, and cascading failure risks, then propose mitigations for each.

practical.title: Architecture Fitness Functions
practical.description: Learn to define and implement automated fitness functions that continuously validate that architecture characteristics (performance, coupling, complexity) remain within acceptable bounds.

advanced.title: Migration Strategy Case Studies
advanced.description: Analysis of large-scale system migrations (monolith to microservices, data center to cloud, legacy rewrites) including the technical and organizational strategies that made them succeed or fail.

advanced.title: Architecture Review Board Participation
advanced.description: Join or establish an architecture review board that evaluates cross-cutting technical decisions, ensuring consistency and quality across the engineering organization.

advanced.title: Staff+ Engineer Architecture Mentorship
advanced.description: Pair with a Staff or Principal engineer to develop the skill of evaluating architectural tradeoffs, navigating ambiguity in large-scale design, and influencing technical direction.

advanced.title: Evolutionary Architecture Framework
advanced.description: A framework for designing systems that support guided, incremental change across multiple dimensions, enabling architecture to evolve alongside changing business requirements.

foundational.title: The Manager's Path
foundational.description: Camille Fournier's guide to engineering leadership at every level, with practical advice on establishing team processes, running effective meetings, and creating operational cadences.

foundational.title: High Output Management
foundational.description: Andy Grove's classic on management fundamentals, introducing concepts like leverage, output measurement, and the managerial activity of creating and maintaining operational rhythms.

foundational.title: Team Topologies
foundational.description: Matthew Skelton and Manuel Pais' framework for organizing teams for fast flow, covering team types, interaction modes, and how operational structure affects software delivery.

foundational.title: Effective Sprint Ceremonies for Engineering Teams
foundational.description: A practical guide to running standups, retrospectives, planning sessions, and demos that actually drive team effectiveness rather than becoming bureaucratic overhead.

practical.title: Team Operating Manual Template
practical.description: A template for documenting your team's operating rhythm including meeting cadences, communication norms, decision-making processes, and escalation paths.

practical.title: Meeting Audit Exercise
practical.description: Audit all recurring meetings for your team over a two-week period, categorizing each by purpose, evaluating effectiveness, and proposing consolidation or elimination of low-value meetings.

practical.title: Operational Review Design Workshop
practical.description: Design a weekly or bi-weekly operational review meeting format that surfaces blockers early, tracks progress toward commitments, and keeps the team aligned without micromanaging.

practical.title: Process Improvement Kanban
practical.description: Use a dedicated Kanban board to track operational improvements, making process changes visible and ensuring the team continuously improves its own ways of working.

advanced.title: Scaling Operational Rhythms Across Multiple Teams
advanced.description: Case studies of how engineering organizations scaled their operational cadences as they grew from one team to ten, examining what stayed the same and what had to change.

advanced.title: Operations-Focused EM Community of Practice
advanced.description: A community of practice for engineering managers focused on sharing and refining operational practices, meeting monthly to discuss what's working and what isn't.

advanced.title: Director-Level Operational Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a Director of Engineering to learn how to design operational rhythms that scale, balancing team autonomy with organizational alignment and visibility.

advanced.title: The Operational Excellence Framework
advanced.description: A comprehensive framework covering the five pillars of operational leadership: cadence design, information flow, decision velocity, accountability structures, and continuous improvement loops.

foundational.title: Influence Without Authority
foundational.description: Allan Cohen and David Bradford's guide to building influence through reciprocity and mutual benefit, essential for engineering leaders who must work across organizational boundaries.

foundational.title: Crucial Conversations
foundational.description: Tools for navigating high-stakes discussions where opinions vary and emotions run strong, directly applicable to cross-functional negotiations and alignment meetings.

foundational.title: The Art of Cross-Functional Collaboration in Tech
foundational.description: A practical article on building productive working relationships with Product, Design, Data Science, and other functions, including common pitfalls and how to avoid them.

foundational.title: Stakeholder Mapping for Engineering Leaders
foundational.description: A talk on identifying key stakeholders, understanding their motivations and concerns, and developing tailored influence strategies for each.

practical.title: Stakeholder Map Template
practical.description: A visual template for mapping stakeholders by influence and interest, identifying allies, blockers, and people who need to be informed or consulted on engineering decisions.

practical.title: Cross-Functional Alignment Workshop
practical.description: A structured workshop format for bringing engineering, product, and design together to align on priorities, surface hidden dependencies, and commit to shared outcomes.

practical.title: Influence Conversation Role-Play
practical.description: Practice influence skills through role-playing scenarios such as convincing a product manager to prioritize tech debt, or negotiating timeline changes with a business stakeholder.

practical.title: RACI Matrix Builder
practical.description: A tool for creating RACI matrices that clarify who is Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, and Informed for cross-functional initiatives, reducing confusion and conflict.

advanced.title: Cross-Functional Influence at Scale
advanced.description: Case studies of engineering leaders who successfully drove cross-functional initiatives (platform migrations, process changes, org restructures) that required buy-in from multiple functions.

advanced.title: Executive Influence Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior leader skilled at cross-functional influence to develop strategies for building coalitions, managing resistance, and driving alignment at the executive level.

advanced.title: Cross-Functional Leadership Forum
advanced.description: A forum bringing together leaders from engineering, product, design, and operations to discuss collaboration challenges and develop shared norms for working together effectively.

advanced.title: The Influence Architecture Framework
advanced.description: A framework for systematically building influence across an organization, covering relationship mapping, currency identification, trust building, and strategic communication patterns.

foundational.title: The Coaching Habit
foundational.description: Michael Bungay Stanier's guide to asking better questions and giving less advice, transforming managers from problem-solvers into coaches who develop their team's capabilities.

foundational.title: Radical Candor
foundational.description: Kim Scott's framework for caring personally while challenging directly, providing the foundation for honest feedback conversations that drive growth.

foundational.title: Thanks for the Feedback
foundational.description: Douglas Stone and Sheila Heen's exploration of why feedback is hard to receive and how to create conditions where it lands effectively, essential for managers who give feedback daily.

foundational.title: Growth Mindset and Engineering Teams
foundational.description: How to cultivate a growth mindset culture on engineering teams, moving from a fixed-ability worldview to one where skills are developed through deliberate practice and stretch assignments.

practical.title: Individual Development Plan (IDP) Template
practical.description: A structured template for creating individual development plans that connect an engineer's career aspirations with specific skills to develop, experiences to seek, and milestones to track.

practical.title: Coaching Conversation Practice
practical.description: Practice the GROW model (Goal, Reality, Options, Will) through simulated coaching conversations covering common engineering scenarios: career pivots, skill gaps, and performance challenges.

practical.title: Stretch Assignment Design Workshop
practical.description: Learn to identify and design stretch assignments that push engineers just beyond their comfort zone, with appropriate scaffolding to ensure learning without overwhelming risk.

practical.title: Feedback Journaling Tool
practical.description: A structured journaling practice for tracking feedback given and received, noting patterns, and improving the quality and impact of coaching conversations over time.

advanced.title: Talent Development at High-Growth Companies
advanced.description: How companies like Shopify, Stripe, and Datadog developed engineering talent at scale, including mentorship programs, internal mobility, and leadership development pipelines.

advanced.title: Coaching Skills Peer Practice Group
advanced.description: A small group of engineering managers who meet regularly to practice coaching skills on each other, providing a safe environment to experiment with new techniques and get feedback.

advanced.title: Executive Coach Partnership
advanced.description: Work with a professional executive coach to deepen your own coaching skills, understand your coaching blind spots, and develop the ability to coach engineers through complex career transitions.

advanced.title: The Talent Density Framework
advanced.description: A framework for systematically increasing team capability through targeted hiring, coaching, stretch assignments, and performance management, raising the bar across the organization.

foundational.title: Thinking in Bets
foundational.description: Annie Duke's guide to making better decisions under uncertainty, teaching how to separate decision quality from outcome quality and communicate probabilistic thinking.

foundational.title: The Pyramid Principle
foundational.description: Barbara Minto's framework for structured communication, teaching how to organize ideas hierarchically so that key messages land clearly with any audience.

foundational.title: Writing Well as an Engineering Leader
foundational.description: Practical guidance on writing effective technical documents, proposals, and updates that are clear, concise, and tailored to their audience.

foundational.title: Decision-Making Frameworks for Engineering Managers
foundational.description: A talk covering common decision-making frameworks (DACI, consent-based, advisory) and how to choose the right one based on the type and impact of the decision.

practical.title: Decision Document Template
practical.description: A one-page template for framing decisions that includes context, options with tradeoffs, recommendation, risks, and reversibility assessment, designed for executive audiences.

practical.title: Executive Communication Workshop
practical.description: Practice presenting technical decisions to non-technical executives, focusing on framing, storytelling, managing objections, and tailoring depth to the audience.

practical.title: Decision Journal Exercise
practical.description: Maintain a decision journal for 90 days, recording each significant decision's context, reasoning, confidence level, and expected outcome, then reviewing to identify patterns and improve.

practical.title: Pre-mortem Facilitation Tool
practical.description: A structured pre-mortem process for stress-testing decisions before committing, imagining future failure and working backward to identify hidden risks and assumptions.

advanced.title: High-Stakes Decision Communication Case Studies
advanced.description: Analysis of how engineering leaders communicated critical decisions (platform rewrites, team restructures, outage responses) including what worked, what failed, and lessons learned.

advanced.title: Senior Leader Communication Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a VP-level leader known for exceptional communication to develop your ability to frame complex technical decisions for diverse audiences and build consensus.

advanced.title: Decision Quality Community of Practice
advanced.description: A group of senior engineering leaders who meet to review past decisions, share decision-making techniques, and collectively improve the quality of decisions across the organization.

advanced.title: The Decision Architecture Framework
advanced.description: A comprehensive framework for designing organizational decision-making processes, covering decision rights, information flow, escalation triggers, and communication protocols.

foundational.title: Site Reliability Engineering (The Google SRE Book)
foundational.description: Google's definitive guide to SRE principles and practices, covering incident management, postmortems, risk management, and building reliable systems at scale.

foundational.title: Incident Management for Operations
foundational.description: Rob Schnepp's guide to structured incident management, covering incident command systems, communication during crises, and post-incident learning processes.

foundational.title: The Field Guide to Understanding Human Error
foundational.description: Sidney Dekker's essential reading on moving beyond blame in incident analysis, understanding how well-intentioned actions lead to failure, and building just cultures.

foundational.title: Introduction to Chaos Engineering
foundational.description: A course covering the principles and practices of chaos engineering, including how to design experiments that proactively surface reliability weaknesses before they cause outages.

practical.title: Incident Response Runbook Template
practical.description: A template for creating incident response runbooks that cover detection, triage, mitigation, communication, and escalation for common failure scenarios.

practical.title: Blameless Postmortem Workshop
practical.description: A facilitated workshop teaching how to run effective blameless postmortems that focus on systemic causes, extract actionable learnings, and drive meaningful reliability improvements.

practical.title: Incident Response Tabletop Exercise
practical.description: Run a tabletop simulation of a major incident, practicing roles (incident commander, communications lead, technical lead), decision-making under pressure, and stakeholder communication.

practical.title: Error Budget Tracking Tool
practical.description: Set up and use error budget tracking to make reliability investment decisions data-driven, balancing feature velocity with reliability based on SLO consumption rates.

advanced.title: Major Outage Case Studies
advanced.description: Detailed analysis of major outages at companies like AWS, Cloudflare, and GitLab, examining cascading failures, organizational response, and long-term reliability improvements that resulted.

advanced.title: Reliability Engineering Mentorship
advanced.description: Partner with a senior SRE or reliability-focused engineering leader to develop skills in risk assessment, reliability program design, and building a culture of operational excellence.

advanced.title: Learning from Incidents Community
advanced.description: Join the Learning from Incidents community to engage with practitioners sharing insights on incident analysis, human factors, and building resilient sociotechnical systems.

advanced.title: Resilience Engineering Framework
advanced.description: A framework for building organizational resilience that goes beyond preventing failures to developing adaptive capacity, graceful degradation, and rapid recovery capabilities.

foundational.title: Accelerate: The Science of Lean Software and DevOps
foundational.description: Nicole Forsgren, Jez Humble, and Gene Kim's research-backed guide to measuring software delivery performance using the four key metrics: deployment frequency, lead time, MTTR, and change failure rate.

foundational.title: How to Measure Anything
foundational.description: Douglas Hubbard's guide to applied information economics, teaching how to quantify seemingly intangible things and make better decisions with imperfect data.

foundational.title: Measure What Matters
foundational.description: John Doerr's introduction to OKRs (Objectives and Key Results), providing a framework for setting measurable goals that align teams with organizational outcomes.

foundational.title: Engineering Metrics That Matter
foundational.description: A practical guide to selecting engineering metrics that drive behavior change, avoid Goodhart's Law pitfalls, and genuinely reflect team health and delivery effectiveness.

practical.title: Engineering Metrics Dashboard Template
practical.description: A template for building an engineering metrics dashboard covering DORA metrics, developer experience scores, quality indicators, and outcome-based measures.

practical.title: Metric Selection Workshop
practical.description: A facilitated session where teams identify the behaviors they want to encourage, select metrics that proxy for those behaviors, and design safeguard metrics to prevent gaming.

practical.title: OKR Writing Exercise
practical.description: Practice writing engineering OKRs that are outcome-focused rather than output-focused, measurable, ambitious but achievable, and aligned with broader organizational goals.

practical.title: Developer Experience Survey Tool
practical.description: Design and deploy a developer experience survey measuring satisfaction, productivity friction, tooling effectiveness, and psychological safety, then use results to prioritize improvements.

advanced.title: Engineering Productivity Measurement at Scale
advanced.description: How companies like Google (SPACE framework), Microsoft, and LinkedIn measure engineering productivity without reducing complex work to simplistic vanity metrics.

advanced.title: Data-Driven Engineering Leadership Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a leader experienced in building measurement cultures to learn how to introduce metrics without creating anxiety, use data to tell stories, and evolve metrics as teams mature.

advanced.title: Engineering Analytics Community
advanced.description: A community of engineering leaders focused on measurement and analytics, sharing dashboards, metric definitions, survey instruments, and lessons learned from measurement programs.

advanced.title: The Outcomes-Over-Outputs Framework
advanced.description: A framework for shifting teams from measuring outputs (story points, PRs merged) to measuring outcomes (user impact, business results), including techniques for attributing outcomes to engineering work.

foundational.title: The Phoenix Project
foundational.description: Gene Kim's novel about IT transformation, illustrating how work-in-progress limits, constraint management, and resource allocation decisions determine organizational performance.

foundational.title: Slack: Getting Past Burnout, Busywork, and the Myth of Total Efficiency
foundational.description: Tom DeMarco's argument for maintaining organizational slack, directly relevant to resource allocation decisions that balance efficiency with adaptability and innovation.

foundational.title: Engineering Investment Categories
foundational.description: A guide to categorizing engineering work into investment categories (feature development, platform, tech debt, innovation) and establishing healthy allocation ratios.

foundational.title: Theory of Constraints for Software Teams
foundational.description: A talk on applying Goldratt's Theory of Constraints to software engineering, identifying bottlenecks and allocating resources to maximize throughput of the entire system.

practical.title: Resource Allocation Matrix Template
practical.description: A template for visualizing how engineering resources are allocated across teams, projects, and investment categories, making tradeoffs explicit and enabling data-driven rebalancing.

practical.title: Build vs. Buy Analysis Workshop
practical.description: A structured workshop for evaluating build vs. buy decisions, considering total cost of ownership, strategic differentiation, maintenance burden, and opportunity cost.

practical.title: Capacity Planning Exercise
practical.description: Practice capacity planning for a quarter, accounting for planned work, unplanned work, on-call rotations, learning time, and the reality that developers are not fungible.

practical.title: Investment Portfolio Tracker
practical.description: A tracking tool that categorizes all engineering work by investment type and visualizes allocation over time, enabling leaders to ensure investment ratios match strategic intent.

advanced.title: Resource Allocation During Hypergrowth
advanced.description: Case studies of how companies like Uber, Airbnb, and DoorDash made resource allocation decisions during rapid growth, balancing scale-up needs with feature velocity and reliability.

advanced.title: Resource Strategy Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior engineering leader to develop skills in headcount planning, budget management, vendor evaluation, and making compelling business cases for engineering investment.

advanced.title: Engineering Finance Community
advanced.description: A community of engineering leaders who share practices around budgeting, cost optimization, cloud spend management, and making engineering investment decisions that align with financial goals.

advanced.title: The Investment Portfolio Framework
advanced.description: A framework treating engineering capacity as an investment portfolio, balancing high-risk/high-reward bets, steady returns, and defensive investments across short and long time horizons.

foundational.title: Who: The A Method for Hiring
foundational.description: Geoff Smart and Randy Street's structured approach to hiring, covering scorecards, sourcing, structured interviews, and reference checks that predict job performance.

foundational.title: Work Rules!
foundational.description: Laszlo Bock's account of Google's people operations, including data-driven insights on what makes hiring processes effective and how to reduce bias in candidate evaluation.

foundational.title: Designing Effective Technical Interview Loops
foundational.description: A practical guide to structuring technical interview loops that assess the right signals, minimize redundancy, reduce candidate fatigue, and produce fair, consistent evaluations.

foundational.title: The First 90 Days for Engineering Hires
foundational.description: How to design onboarding programs that get new engineers to full productivity quickly, covering documentation, buddy systems, starter projects, and milestone check-ins.

practical.title: Job Description and Scorecard Template
practical.description: Templates for writing inclusive, accurate job descriptions and candidate scorecards that focus on demonstrated competencies rather than credential proxies.

practical.title: Interview Calibration Workshop
practical.description: A workshop where interviewers evaluate the same candidate responses independently, then calibrate together to align on what constitutes strong, acceptable, and weak signals.

practical.title: Onboarding Program Design Exercise
practical.description: Design a 30-60-90 day onboarding plan for a new engineer joining your team, including learning objectives, key relationships to build, and progressively complex deliverables.

practical.title: Role Architecture Tool
practical.description: A tool for designing engineering roles that clearly delineate scope, expectations, growth paths, and how each role fits into the broader team and organizational structure.

advanced.title: Scaling Hiring at High-Growth Startups
advanced.description: Case studies of how fast-growing companies built and scaled their engineering hiring processes while maintaining quality, speed, and candidate experience.

advanced.title: Talent Acquisition Strategy Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior engineering leader experienced in building teams from scratch to learn sourcing strategies, employer branding, compensation philosophy, and closing techniques.

advanced.title: Engineering Hiring Leaders Forum
advanced.description: A forum of engineering leaders sharing interview questions, process innovations, DEI hiring practices, and data on what predicts long-term success in engineering roles.

advanced.title: The Talent Lifecycle Framework
advanced.description: An end-to-end framework connecting role design, sourcing, interviewing, onboarding, development, and retention into a cohesive talent strategy that compounds over time.

foundational.title: The Culture Code
foundational.description: Daniel Coyle's research into what makes high-performing group cultures work, identifying three key skills: building safety, sharing vulnerability, and establishing purpose.

foundational.title: No Rules Rules: Netflix and the Culture of Reinvention
foundational.description: Reed Hastings and Erin Meyer's account of building Netflix's culture of freedom and responsibility, offering a provocative model for engineering team culture.

foundational.title: Turn the Ship Around!
foundational.description: L. David Marquet's account of transforming a submarine crew from a leader-follower to a leader-leader model, directly applicable to building empowered engineering teams.

foundational.title: Psychological Safety in Engineering Teams
foundational.description: How to create and maintain psychological safety on engineering teams, drawing from Google's Project Aristotle research and practical implementation strategies.

practical.title: Team Charter Template
practical.description: A template for creating a team charter that articulates shared values, working agreements, communication norms, and how the team handles conflict and decision-making.

practical.title: Culture Retrospective Workshop
practical.description: A facilitated retrospective format specifically designed to surface cultural dynamics, identify norms that help and hinder the team, and co-create cultural improvements.

practical.title: Norm Setting Exercise
practical.description: Lead your team through an explicit norm-setting exercise covering code review etiquette, meeting behavior, Slack communication patterns, and how disagreements are handled.

practical.title: Psychological Safety Assessment Tool
practical.description: A lightweight survey instrument for measuring psychological safety on your team, with specific questions adapted for engineering contexts and guidance on interpreting results.

advanced.title: Culture Transformation Case Studies
advanced.description: How engineering organizations at Etsy, Slack, and Shopify deliberately shaped their cultures, including specific practices, rituals, and artifacts that reinforced desired behaviors.

advanced.title: Organizational Culture Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior leader who has successfully shaped engineering culture at scale to learn how culture propagates, how to diagnose cultural issues, and how to drive change.

advanced.title: Engineering Culture Leaders Network
advanced.description: A network of engineering leaders focused on culture, sharing practices around inclusion, remote work norms, innovation culture, and managing culture through organizational change.

advanced.title: The Culture Operating System Framework
advanced.description: A framework for treating culture as a system with inputs (hiring, rituals, artifacts), processes (norms, feedback loops), and outputs (behaviors, outcomes), enabling deliberate culture design.

foundational.title: Security Engineering: A Guide to Building Dependable Distributed Systems
foundational.description: Ross Anderson's comprehensive guide to security engineering, covering threat modeling, access control, cryptography, and the human factors that make security succeed or fail.

foundational.title: The Phoenix Project (Security Thread)
foundational.description: Gene Kim's novel includes a security subplot that illustrates how security and compliance can be integrated into delivery processes rather than being gatekeeping functions.

foundational.title: OWASP Top 10 for Engineering Managers
foundational.description: A course covering the OWASP Top 10 web application security risks from a management perspective, focusing on how to build processes that prevent these vulnerabilities systematically.

foundational.title: Compliance as Code: An Introduction
foundational.description: How modern engineering organizations automate compliance requirements through policy-as-code, automated auditing, and continuous compliance monitoring.

practical.title: Threat Modeling Workshop Template
practical.description: A template for running threat modeling sessions using STRIDE methodology, including worksheets for identifying assets, threats, mitigations, and residual risks.

practical.title: Security Review Process Workshop
practical.description: Design a lightweight security review process that integrates into your development workflow, covering when reviews are needed, what to look for, and how to track findings.

practical.title: Compliance Gap Analysis Exercise
practical.description: Conduct a gap analysis of your team's practices against a relevant compliance framework (SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA), identifying gaps and prioritizing remediation efforts.

practical.title: Dependency Vulnerability Scanner
practical.description: Set up and configure automated dependency scanning in your CI/CD pipeline, establishing policies for vulnerability severity levels, SLAs for patching, and exception processes.

advanced.title: Security Incident Response Case Studies
advanced.description: Analysis of real security incidents (SolarWinds, Log4Shell, Equifax) examining how organizational security posture, detection capabilities, and response processes affected outcomes.

advanced.title: CISO or Security Leadership Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a CISO or senior security leader to understand how to build a security-aware engineering culture, manage security risk at the organizational level, and navigate compliance requirements.

advanced.title: DevSecOps Community of Practice
advanced.description: Join a community focused on integrating security into the software development lifecycle, sharing tooling, automation approaches, and strategies for shifting security left.

advanced.title: The Security Posture Maturity Framework
advanced.description: A maturity model for assessing and improving an organization's security posture across dimensions: vulnerability management, access control, data protection, incident response, and compliance automation.

foundational.title: Nine Lies About Work
foundational.description: Marcus Buckingham and Ashley Goodall's challenge to conventional performance management wisdom, arguing for attention-based management over rating-based evaluation.

foundational.title: An Elegant Puzzle (Performance Chapter)
foundational.description: Will Larson's practical guidance on performance management for engineering teams, covering performance designations, managing out, and calibration processes.

foundational.title: The Hard Thing About Hard Things
foundational.description: Ben Horowitz's raw account of difficult management situations, including firing, demotions, and performance conversations that every engineering leader eventually faces.

foundational.title: Engineering Career Ladders and Leveling
foundational.description: A guide to designing and using engineering career ladders effectively, ensuring they serve as tools for growth rather than bureaucratic artifacts.

practical.title: Performance Review Writing Template
practical.description: A structured template for writing performance reviews that are specific, evidence-based, forward-looking, and calibrated against level expectations rather than peer comparison.

practical.title: Calibration Session Facilitation Workshop
practical.description: Learn to facilitate calibration sessions that reduce bias, ensure consistency across managers, and produce fair performance ratings, including techniques for managing disagreement.

practical.title: Difficult Performance Conversation Role-Play
practical.description: Practice delivering tough performance feedback through role-play scenarios including underperformance conversations, PIP discussions, and communicating missed promotions.

practical.title: Continuous Feedback Tracker
practical.description: A tool for capturing feedback and accomplishments throughout the review period, preventing recency bias and ensuring performance reviews reflect the full body of work.

advanced.title: Performance Management System Redesign
advanced.description: How companies like Netflix, Adobe, and Microsoft redesigned their performance management systems, moving away from stack ranking toward approaches that better serve development and accountability.

advanced.title: Performance Management Mentorship
advanced.description: Work with a senior engineering leader experienced in calibration across large organizations to develop skills in fair assessment, bias mitigation, and managing performance at scale.

advanced.title: Engineering Management Performance Forum
advanced.description: A forum for engineering managers to discuss performance management challenges, share calibration rubrics, and develop shared standards for what excellent, good, and underperformance look like.

advanced.title: The Performance Ecosystem Framework
advanced.description: A holistic framework connecting goal setting, continuous feedback, career development, calibration, and compensation into an integrated system that drives both individual growth and organizational performance.
